definition: divination combined with mystical Confucian philosopy, prevalent during the Eastern Han Dynasty (25-220)

sentences.english: This text adopt old view also, think Divination of Confucian originate from Yan Zou spread out period.
sentences.chinese: 本文还采用了陈槃的观点，认为谶纬起源于邹衍时期。

sentences.english: Prophetic Theology is a flow of distinctive social trend of thought in the Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 谶纬是两汉时期独特的社会思潮。

definition: arts of healing, divination, horoscope etc/supernatural arts (old)
Former Han dynasty school of Confucian scholars
interactions between heaven and mankind (Han Dynasty doctrine)
Former Han dynasty school of Confucian scholars
Dong Zhongshu (179-104 BC), philosopher influential in establishing Confucianism as the established system of values of former Han dynasty
the Hundred Schools of Thought, the various schools of thought and their exponents during the Spring and Autumn and Warring States Periods (770-220 BC)
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
Mr Gongyang's Annals or commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history, probably written during Han dynasty, same as 公羊傳|公羊传[Gong1 yang2 Zhuan4]
dismiss the hundred schools, revere only the Confucians (slogan of the Former Han dynasty)
Luxuriant Dew of the Spring and Autumn Annals, ideological tract by Han dynasty political philosopher Dong Zhongshu 董仲舒[Dong3 Zhong4 shu1]
Confucian study of ethics/study of Daoism/school for Daoism in Tang and Song times/Daoist magic/another name for 理學|理学, rational learning of Song dynasty neo-Confucianism
